gw.api.financials

Class FloatingFinancialsCalculations

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.financials.FloatingFinancialsCalculations

  • public class FloatingFinancialsCalculations
extends java.lang.Object
    Static factory class for FinancialsCalculators that use Floating Financials behavior When evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
    Payments and Recoveries are evaluated with fixed rates
    Author:
    akurland

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FloatingFinancialsCalculations() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FinancialsCalculator getAvailableReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Available Reserves.
      FinancialsCalculator getAwaitingSubmissionReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Awaiting Submission Reserves: Always returns a FinancialsCalculator with the useFloatingFinancials behavior turned on

      (Awaiting Submission reserves for today)

      Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
      This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
      FinancialsCalculator getOpenRecoveryReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Open Recovery Reserves:

      Submitted recovery reserves
      -
      Submitted recoveries.
      FinancialsCalculator getOpenReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Open Reserves:

      (Submitted reserves + Awaiting Submission reserves for today)
      -
      (Submitted eroding payments + Awaiting Submission eroding payments for today).
      FinancialsCalculator getPendingApprovalReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Pending Approval Reserves:

      (Reserves pending approval)

      Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
      This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
      FinancialsCalculator getRemainingReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Remaining Reserves:

      (Submitted reserves + Awaiting Submission reserves for today)
      -
      (Submitted eroding payments + Awaiting Submission eroding payments for today + Future eroding payments).
      FinancialsCalculator getSubmittedOpenReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Submitted Open Reserves:

      Reserves - Eroding Payments Submitted

      Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
      This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
      FinancialsCalculator getSubmittedTotalIncurredNet()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Submitted Total Incurred Net:

      Reserves + Payments Submitted - Total Recoveries

      Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
      This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
      FinancialsCalculator getTotalIncurredGross()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Gross Total Incurred:

      Open Reserves + Total Payments.
      FinancialsCalculator getTotalIncurredNet()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Net Total Incurred:

      (Open Reserves + Total Payments)
      -
      Total Recoveries.
      FinancialsCalculator getTotalIncurredNetMinusOpenRecoveryReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Net Total Incurred Minus Open Recovery Reserves (Total Incurred Gross minus Total Recovery Reserves):

      (Open Reserves + Total Payments)
      -
      Total Recovery Reserves.
      FinancialsCalculator getTotalRecoveryReserves()
      Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Total Recovery Reserves:

      Total recovery reserves
      Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
      This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FloatingFinancialsCalculations

        public FloatingFinancialsCalculations()

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableReserves

        public FinancialsCalculator getAvailableReserves()
        Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Available Reserves.

        (Submitted reserves + Awaiting Submission reserves for today)
        -
        (Submitted eroding payments + Awaiting Submission eroding payments for today + Future eroding payments + Pending-approval eroding payments).

        Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
        This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
        Payments and Recoveries are evaluated with fixed rates from their respective transactions.

        Returns:
        FinancialsCalculator representing the defined calculation.

      • getAwaitingSubmissionReserves

        public FinancialsCalculator getAwaitingSubmissionReserves()
        Returns a FinancialsCalculator representing Awaiting Submission Reserves: Always returns a FinancialsCalculator with the useFloatingFinancials behavior turned on

        (Awaiting Submission reserves for today)

        Always returns a FinancialsCalculator which uses floating financials behavior turned on:
        This means when the calculator is evaluating reserving amounts, they are converted into the claim currency using current market rates.
        Payments and Recoveries are evaluated with fixed rates from their respective transactions.

        Returns:
        FinancialsCalculator representing the defined calculation.
